column4: I'm attempting to create my first package for inclusion in my PPA. It's quite simple: just a collection of Truetype fonts that I always install and would rather do it via a .deb than manually install every time I bring up a new box.

This should be fairly straightforward: ultimately, all that happens is a bunch of .ttf files get copied to /usr/share/fonts/truetype/wrstone.com, and the font cache is rebuilt. However, I've been banging my head on the package creation for a couple of days without much success. I've built RPM packages for this before, but the Debian package is apparently an order of magnitude more complex.
Any comments, suggestions, advice, assistance, or nasty remarks would be appreciated.
Please don't flood; use http://paste.ubuntu.com to paste; don't use Enter as punctuation.
